      • CourtHive/Live

    Versions

    Release cycle

    • CourtHive/TMX is in continuous development with frequent releases.
    • The current “stable” version can always be found at https://CourtHive.com/tmx.
    • If your organization hosts a version of CourtHive/TMX, the release cycle may be defined by the organization.

    Understanding the Version Number

    The version number follows this pattern: Major.minor.added.changed.fixed

    • Every time a minor release is made, changed and fixed are reset to zero.
    • Every time a major release is made, added, changed, and fixed are reset to zero.
    • There will be only 9 minor releases within each major release.

    Updating to the latest version

    If your browser supports Service Workers, then a version of CourtHive/TMX is cached locally. The Home icon turns yellow to indicate that a new version is available.

    Context Click on the Home icon to see the update message. When a new version is available, the Service Worker begins updating your cache after you refresh your browser.

    Important: At present you will need to wait a minute or so then refresh your browser a second time to insure that the latest version is loaded; hopefully by the 1.0 release all of this will take place smoothly in the background.
    Note: If your browser does not support Service Workers then refreshing your browser will always load the current version, but you will not be able to load CourtHive/TMX when you are not connected to the internet.
    Tip: Context Click on the Home Icon at any time to check your version.

    Old and New Versions

    • The last version of CourHive/TMX are available on: https://CourtHive.com/tmx-
    • The next release candidate is available on https://CourtHive.com/tmx+
    • Bleeding edge releases and urgent bug fixes are available on https://CourtHive.com/tmx++
